publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1774 Tommy Sheridan: Committees Meeting in Private—That the Parliament is concerned at the increasing tendency of Parliamentary committees to go into private session; notes with particular concern the Health and Community Care Committee’s decision to go into private session on 21 March to discuss the MMR report; believes that this is an issue of huge public interest and should not be heard in private, and calls upon all committees only to go into private session in exceptional circumstances, such as for reasons of protecting an individual’s identity.

S1M-1774 Tommy Sheridan: Committees Meeting in Private—That the Parliament is concerned at the increasing tendency of Parliamentary committees to go into private session; notes with particular concern the Health and Community Care Committee’s decision to go into private session on 21 March to discuss the MMR report; believes that this is an issue of huge public interest and should not be heard in private, and calls upon all committees only to go into private session in exceptional circumstances, such as for reasons of protecting an individual’s identity.
S1M-1774 Committees Meeting in Private (lodged on 21 March 2001) Mr Lloyd Quinan*

S1M-1774 Tommy Sheridan: Committees Meeting in Private—That the Parliament is concerned at the increasing tendency of Parliamentary committees to go into private session; notes with particular concern the Health and Community Care Committee’s decision to go into private session on 21 March to discuss the MMR report; believes that this is an issue of huge public interest and should not be heard in private, and calls upon all committees only to go into private session in exceptional circumstances, such as for reasons of protecting an individual’s identity. Supported by: Mr Lloyd Quinan
S1M-1774 Committees Meeting in Private (lodged on 21 March 2001) Andrew Wilson*
S1M-1774 Committees Meeting in Private (lodged on 21 March 2001) Ms Margo MacDonald*

S1M-1774 Tommy Sheridan: Committees Meeting in Private—That the Parliament is concerned at the increasing tendency of Parliamentary committees to go into private session; notes with particular concern the Health and Community Care Committee’s decision to go into private session on 21 March to discuss the MMR report; believes that this is an issue of huge public interest and should not be heard in private, and calls upon all committees only to go into private session in exceptional circumstances, such as for reasons of protecting an individual’s identity. Supported by: Mr Lloyd Quinan, Andrew Wilson, Ms Margo MacDonald
